channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weeds on fences, 14th November
item.description:
Weeds are growing on the fences. They have not been cut in months. Have tried reporting this over the phone a few weeks ago but yet to receive any update.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barton Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle parked obstructing pavement, 14th November
item.description:
The truck keeps parking here blocking the pavement making it dangerous as you have to step out into the road! My child could not even pass it! Very close to primary school as well!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscar Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many pavements broken or crocked on road., 14th November
item.description:
There are a number of pavement slabs that is cracked and wobbly. Someone will soon have an accident if this isn't repaired soon. I believe it's due to the building of the new estate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London

item.description:

item.title: Van abandoned for 3 months with no MOT, 14th November
item.description:
Van dumped in Ambleside Road 3 months ago has no MOT and taking a valuable parking space. (Number plate BN65KYA) This has been reported to yourselves on 2 separate occasions, the police were then informed because of your lack of interest, and said we need to inform yourselves to get the vehicle removed which is why you are being contacted yet again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Ambleside Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piles of poop on pavement, 14th November
item.description:
A pile of fresh dog poop near to no 78 Walden on edge of drive meets pavement and several smears and smudges of dog poop all over pavement where people have stepped in it unfortunately. Very difficult to navigate to avoid and now the rain has made it spread and become more messy. How can people walk dogs without picking up after them? Terrible attitude and gives other dog walkers a bad reputation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walden Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 14th November
item.description:
Graffiti on dog waste bin at Elmstead Lane entrance to Elmstead Wood (what3words location ///gear.backed.toast) It's hard to understand why someone would spend their time scribbling on a container full of animal excrement, but each to their own

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines faded, 14th November
item.description:
The double yellow lines from the corner of stone road to just before the bus stop opposite Beadon Road are badly faded so people are starting to park cars. This is forcing traffic to move into the opposite lane on the downhill stretch just before the bus stop. With cars parked opposite (legally) it's only a matter of time before there's an accident. I have reported this earlier this year resulting in the lines on the opposite side of the road (which weren't faced) being repainted.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
